title: Strictly judge Motsi Mabuse didn't know people listened to podcasts
text:
We think she might be the only one who thinks podcasts aren’t a thing (Picture: Ken McKay/ITV/REX)

Strictly Come Dancing judge Motsi Mabuse has just discovered the magic world of podcasts and we’re really curious to know how she never thought about it before.

The 38-year-old dancer tweeted out her revelation today, asking fans whether she should partake in this brand new, very unpopular concept.

She tweeted to her fans: ‘Guys are podcasts a thing ???? And if yes , Who would you recommend??’

The entire tweet deserves an Emmy as it was pure artistry that will be hard to forget about.

It took us on a rollercoaster ride of emotions – from the initial questioning of its existence to the acceptance of its existence and being open to trying out this concept – and we will never be the same again.

Meanwhile, her fans took the opportunity to suggest names of the best podcasts to listen to.

Most people suggested she starts her journey with Chris Ramsey, but she seemed a little sceptical.

Guys are podcasts a thing ???? And if yes , Who would you recommend?? — Motsi Mabuse (@MOTSI_MABUSE) October 17, 2019

Somebody get this woman her own podcast (Picture: BBC)

A fan wrote: ‘Obviously #ShaggedMarriedAnnoyed by Basketball hands himself @IAmChrisRamsey and @Rosemarino’ to which Motsi replied: ‘Thanks I really have a hard time understanding @IAmChrisRamsey I know his speaking English but my ears hear something else lol !! I will try harder !’

Strictly dancer Kevin Clifton soon noticed that Motsi and her fans were exchanging names of podcasts which they thought were best, so he had to chime in.

‘U not listening to my podcast yet motsi? Come and be a guest on it [sic],’ Kevin tweeted, adding a love heart emoji.

If that’s all it takes to get to be a guest on a podcast, we’ll need to try this method out.

Is co-starring in a movie with Tom Hardy for £3 million real? If yes, would you recommend?

While Motsi tries to find her new favourite podcast, fellow Strictly judge Craig Revel Horwood has been hit out at James Jordan after he slammed the judges’ decision to axe Dev Griffin from the show last weekend.

Dev and Dianne were eliminated (Picture: BBC)

The 54-year-old panellist has claimed that the dancing pro is ‘just out for the publicity’ after he and his three fellow judges opted to send the Radio 1 DJ home.

James later shot to the defence of Dev and Dianne and claimed the judging was ‘all over the place’ and he even branded them ‘liars’.

Although Craig has now hit back at James and said that Dev was the worst dancer on the night and they did make the right decision.

He said: ‘James Jordan is just out for publicity and if he was on the judging panel, I’m telling you looking at it you have to judge on what you see.’

The judge then went on to say Dev made mistakes but was getting better.
